curam.util.client.domain.convert

Class SvrInt32BareConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.common.plugin.AbstractPlugIn
      • curam.util.common.domain.AbstractDomainPlugIn
        • curam.util.client.domain.AbstractClientDomainPlugIn
          • curam.util.client.domain.convert.AbstractConverter
            • curam.util.client.domain.convert.SvrInt32Converter
              • curam.util.client.domain.convert.SvrInt32BareConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    curam.util.client.domain.convert.ClientDomainConverter, DomainConverter, DomainPlugIn, PlugIn

    public class SvrInt32BareConverter
extends SvrInt32Converter
    Converter for the SVR_INT32 domain that formats and parses values in a non-locale-specific manner. This may be used for internal identifiers, as these values are not displayed on the pages and are used mostly as parameter values. The formatter does not use a grouping (e.g., thousands) separator character and the parser always expects the minus sign to be on the left of the number.

    • Method Detail

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(java.lang.Object data)
        Formats a number without grouping separator characters and, for negative numbers, places the minus sign on the left. This relies on the basic behavior of the java.util.Integer.toString method.
        Specified by:
        format in interface DomainConverter
        Overrides:
        format in class AbstractConverter
        Parameters:
        data - The number to be formatted. This will be a java.util.Integer object.
        Returns:
        The number formatted to a string.
        See Also:
        DomainConverter.format(Object)

      • parse

        public java.lang.Object parse(java.lang.String data)
                       throws ConversionException
        Parses a number. The number should not contain grouping separator characters or a decimal point. For negative numbers, the minus sign should be on the left, regardless of the locale. This relies on the basic behavior of the java.util.Integer.valueOf(String) method.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface DomainConverter
        Overrides:
        parse in class SvrInt32Converter
        Parameters:
        data - The string to be parsed.
        Returns:
        The java.util.Integer parsed from the string.
        Throws:
        ConversionException - If the format is invalid and cannot be parsed.
